algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using a min-heap to repeatedly combine the smallest sticks.
problem_summary_simple: Connect sticks to form one stick with minimum total cost.
problem_summary_technical: A min-heap stores stick lengths. Repeatedly extract two smallest, sum them (cost), and re-insert the sum until one stick remains.
key_insights: The problem exhibits optimal substructure and the greedy choice property.
Always combining the two smallest sticks minimizes the cost at each step.
A min-heap is the ideal data structure for efficiently retrieving the smallest elements.
